Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> we can spread things out a long time, or concentrate more mining rewards in the early times. One way benefits early miners more, the other helps later miners

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <halo kitty rules> I'm not fan of short-term solutions. High block rewards are path to (hyper)inflation and even  hybrid POW/POS mechanism can't prevent that. Cheap coins have ruined HUSH's market and they can ruin BTCH's too. Benefiting early miners may accelerate immediate trading, but it's long-term devestating. It's probably better way, a sustainable one, to go with lower block reward and longer halving periods. At some stage inflation shouldn't be higher as few % annualy.

Content: [dscrd-hush] <Takoy_Nahal> As chinmaydshah correctly said earlier, it is necessary to reduce the number of coins later to prevent high inflation. But in the beginning there should be generous blocks. It will be a certain bait, as the fisherman attracts fish)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RemoteConTroll> You wouldn‚Äôt necessarily need to attract miners.  Attracting stakers would raise the price as people would want to buy to stake.  If each coin worth more.  It is just as valuable to mine less coins that are worth more.

Content: [dscrd-hush] <RemoteConTroll> And that would attract miners should coins be worth more

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I am writing tests and finding bugs in VerusHash algo in latest KMD, so I guess you could say the new BTCH is coming along üòÉ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Takoy_Nahal> Very good Duke!

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> not really "bugs", but "integration issues", which are very common with such a huge merge

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> just need to turn the lights on in each room and scare the bugs into hiding

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> these automated tests help KMD, BTCH and every asset chain in the ecosystem

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> in the future, it can help prevent regressions and point out issues very fast

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Takoy_Nahal> Is it possible that Verushash can embed an algorithm in any other Komodo asset chains?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Any new KMD asset chain can choose VerusHash OR Equihash, where before it was only Equihash

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> also, the code is more general, and allows for others to add different PoW algorithm options

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> before, things were very hardcoded to Equihash and even trying to choose another algo was very hard, even at compile time

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Takoy_Nahal does that answer your question?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Takoy_Nahal> Yes

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> currently this is only available on the most bleeding edge branch of KMD, so it's not *quite* ready for average users. I would say its in "alpha testing"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> the way things go is James merges the latest/newest code in FSM branch, then occasionally that is merged to `jl777` branch and then `dev` branch and finally one day it reaches `master`

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> once these features trickle down to the `dev` branch, they are pretty stable

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it's a great time to get involved, to help with testing and stuff, if people like that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> best thing to do in a bear market is learn, mine, tinker, and avoid thinking about prices üòÉ

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> people will be able to switch between BTCH and VRSC mining seemlessly

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Takoy_Nahal> @dukeleto Now the price does not bother me, for me it is important to collect more portfolio)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> with what is going on in VRSC, BTCH is probably going to get a lot of miners from that community

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> nothing happens by default. Currently we are still on Sprout, and will upgrade to Sapling

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Blossom is still just a few ideas on Github, they are still in the idea gathering stage

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @gilardh i don't know of any programs that parse it, but some might. what kind of changes do you have in mind?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Takoy_Nahal so we don't inherit by default, but we could if we want it. It takes work to upgrade, a pretty large amount

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> that is why it's amazing that all KMD asset chains get Sapling, for free, because jl777 is a coding wizard

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Takoy_Nahal> I absolutely do not doubt it)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> the amount of work to do it, for each external coin ... it's a huge amount. BTCH will have Sapling before Hush, that is fore sure

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and so, BTCH will have Sapling before most Zcash forks as well, without even having a dedicated developer team

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Takoy_Nahal> And not having a large amount of money

# Wallet dump created by myhushwallet v2.0.9 # Created on 2018-11-23T21:50:01Z xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx 2018-11-23T21:50:01Z label= # addr=nnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnn 2018-11-23T21:50:01Z label= # addr=yyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy 2018-11-23T21:50:01Z label= # addr=zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz

Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> no, it's not a good idea

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> the `#` means it's a comment. it's not really needed to change this file. Are you saying the original file is missing linebreaks or something?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gilardh> yes, it misses line breaks under Windows anyway. Not tested under linux.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <gilardh> '''
      fileStr += this.props.publicAddresses[key].privateKeyWIF
      fileStr += ' ' + now + ' label= # addr=' + key
      fileStr += '\n'
'''

You can assume there will always be 1440  blocks per day (1 minute blocks) because with mining, there will always be a transaction every minute (somebody will want to get the block reward and get a mining coinbase transaction)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Zeyu BTCH is a KMD asset chain, which means it's feature complete and has a large dev team, headed by jl777 (who is also a co-founder of BTCH)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> BTCH will have Zcash Sapling in a few days/weeks. BTCH has "no dedicated devs" and yet more dev resources than HUSH, since KMD is a larger community

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Zeyu I have code in almost every Zcash fork, I work on many things. And I work on many open source projects outside  of cryptocoins. Your question is a "false duality", assuming there can only be "A or B" when that is false

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Duke works on whatever he wants, because nobody pays Duke to do anything

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> if you want Duke to work on something specific, make it rain. Otherwise, just sit back and enjoy the entertainment

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Sometimes I fix a bug in KMD, which also goes to ZEC, which I also fix in HUSH

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> hence, your question is nonsensical

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and to clarify, when you fix a bug in KMD, it gets fixed in every asset chain (BTCH is one), there are something like 50 now: http://notarystats.com/

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> so when you say "How can you work TWO COINS AT ONCE (omg)?????"  I just laugh
